result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Sex Offender Registry for life.  Case plan.  May not have contact with minors except as allowed by agent.  Participate in and follow recommendations of sex offender treatment, drug, alcohol, and mental health evaluation.  No contact with Linda R, Irma L, Katie B, Cyndi N, Nicole R, Lucy P, Lindsey P R, and Kirsten R.

Dated February 12, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 12, 2018, that: IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt is relieved from further representing Jason L. Reed in these appeals.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Dated February 12, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Dated December 5, 2018 - IT IS ORDERED that, as a one-time courtesy, the clerk of this court is directed to provide Mr. Reed, together with a copy of this order, a copy of his October 15, 2018 supplemental petition, which Mr. Reed shall then serve on the Attorney General. Mr. Reed is advised that the clerk of this court is neither required nor authorized to serve papers on his behalf. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the State of Wisconsin's time for filing a response to the petition for review shall commence as of the date of service of Mr. Reed's supplemental petition.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Counts 1 and 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 4, 5 and 6 - Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
State's AMENDED List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Thomas Binger  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on State's motions.  Motion to join 14CF900, 15CF956 and 15CF1212 for trial is granted by the court, but the other acts motions are denied.  Case remains on for trial as previously scheduled.
Permitting Withdrawal of Counsel (Atty David Celebre)

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Attys David Celebre and Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Celebre is allowed to withdraw as counsel due to a conflict of interest.  Atty Caspari will be taking over as attorney for def.  Case is set for jury trial on 2/15/16, but Atty Caspari requests an adjournment.  Request for speedy trial is withdrawn.  Motion for joinder and motion to admit other acts to be heard on 3/9/16 at 9:30.  Atty Caspari was given a copy of that motion today by ADA Binger and Atty Caspari indicates she will be filing a written response to the motions.  Jury status hearing 5/5/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 5/9/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Celebre indicates he is ready to proceed to jury trial on 12/7/15 on Counts 1, 2, and 3.  ADA Binger requests an adjournment of the trial, as 2 of the victims are not available on 12/7/15.  Court grants ADA Binger's request and orders all 6 counts to be tried at the same time.  Speedy trial demand made by Atty Celebre.  Jury status hearing 2/11/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 2/15/16 at 8:30 (4 - 5 days).  State will be filing new charges and will file a motion to join this file, 15CF956, and the new file.  Hearing on motion for joinder 1/27/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.

State's motion to adjourn the 12/7/15 jury trial heard; Atty Celebre objects to an adjournment.  On 10/5/15 the Court had denied a motion to sever counts.  Court at this time will reconsider that motion.  Court grants request to adjourn Counts 4, 5, and 6.  Re:  Counts 1, 2, and 3 - Status conf. 12/4/15 at 9:00 to determine if these counts will go to jury trial on 12/7/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.  Jury status hearing on 12/3/15 at 1:00 is removed from the calendar.
Motions filed by ADA Binger on 11/9/15 and 11/19/15 will be heard on 12/2/15 at 1:45.  Atty Celebre notified by phone; ADA Binger notified by email.
